Getting Started

This documentation assumes that you are already familiar with TypeScript, Expressjs and also some of the tools from the latest standards such as classes and modules. The code samples are written using TypeScript (can be written with the latest JavaScript) and using decorators for metadata.

Prerequisites

Dinoloop is built on top of async-await, so please make sure your Node.js installed version supports Async and Promise. Dinoloop uses express.Router extensively for API routing, so install a recent version of Express.js that supports express.Router. The following is a list of the versions we have tested. Please direct any issues to github to help the community.

  • Node.js 8.10.x or higher
  • Expressjs 4.3.x or higher
  • TypeScript 2.2.x or higher

Recommended

  • As Dinoloop is built on top of expressjs, some basic understanding of Nodejs and expressjs is not a must but it will help you.
  • Dinoloop designed to use async-await (es2017) syntax which is essential if you prefer async-await pattern.
  • We recommend VSCode editor which has great support for typescript tooling and debugging.

Installation

1. Starter project without DI framework

$ git clone https://github.com/ParallelTask/dinoloop-starter.git
$ cd dinoloop-starter
$ npm install
$ npm start

2. Starter project with Inversifyjs DI framework

$ git clone https://github.com/ParallelTask/dinoloop-inversify-starter.git
$ cd dinoloop-inversify-starter
$ npm install
$ npm start

Navigate to http://localhost:8088/api/home/get in browser. You should be able to see the "Hello World!" response

3. Build a basic CRUD application without cloning starter
